noun.description: An action intended to deceive someone; a trick.
examples: Eleanor tried to think of a ruse to get Paul out of the house

proper noun.description: An industrial city and the principal port of Bulgaria, on the Danube River; population 156,959 (2008).

origin: Late Middle English (as a hunting term): from Old French, from ruser use trickery, earlier drive back, perhaps based on Latin rursus backwards.
